intro: [WRONG START] Astellia cockaynei, commonly known as the Cook Strait astelia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences bearing small, white or cream-colored flowers. It is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Astelia cockaynei is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its elegant appearance.
